description: softcover book; color image looking at and past a man's back at a sparse street scene; man is wearing pink hat that says, "birthday" on L, and a white tank top; purple and yellow hand-made paper pages with abstract drawings, black and white photo reproductions, and sparse text; bound volume; lender's archive #35
image_copyright: © David Tremlett %2F Artists Rights Society %28ARS%29%2C New York
provenance: William P. Kosmas, London, England (d. 2017); Estate of William P. Kosmas, Minneapolis; given to MIA, 2018.
signed: Signed in pencil on first page, LRQ: [For Bill │ David Tremlett │ 2005]
text: If Things Could Talk features notes, sketches, ticket stubs, receipts, floor plans, and photographs that British artist and illustrator David Tremlett assembled from his travels through India. Each of Tremlett’s black-and-white illustrations is accompanied by the artist’s journal-like prose, which combines observations and free association, an intriguing method of representing “place” from the perspective of the outsider.
title: If Things Could Talk
